summary: This document is an email chain from April 20, 2021, where Sharon Cohen Levin of Sullivan & Cromwell LLP inquires about efforts by the SDNY or DOJ to recover funds for Jeffrey Epstein's victims, specifically mentioning asset forfeiture/restitution efforts and referencing the Maxwell prosecution and a lawsuit by the US Virgin Islands Attorney General against the Epstein estate.

persons.name: Sharon Cohen Levin
persons.context: She is the author of the initial inquiry email, asking about asset forfeiture and restitution efforts for Epstein's victims by SDNY or DOJ.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Referenced as the individual whose estate is subject to victim recovery efforts and lawsuits.

events.title: US Virgin Islands lawsuit against Epstein estate
events.description: The Attorney General of the US Virgin Islands sued the Epstein estate in January 2020, after Epstein's death, establishing a fund for victims.

keyFacts: An inquiry was made in April 2021 about DOJ/SDNY efforts to recover funds for Epstein's victims.
A victim compensation fund was established through a lawsuit by the US Virgin Islands Attorney General against the Epstein estate in January 2020.
The email specifically asks if there are asset forfeiture or restitution efforts in the SDNY related to the Maxwell prosecution.
